jparsec.model

Class MieTheory

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.model.MieTheory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MieTheory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An implementation of the Mie theory.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public int nang
        Number of angles to compute. Greater than 1, and as large as possible, but must be lower than a limits of 1000. A value of 10 adequate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MieTheory

        public MieTheory()
        Empty constructor.

      • MieTheory

        public MieTheory(double a,
         double lambda,
         Complex cxref,
         int nang)
          throws JPARSECException
        Explicit constructor. This constructor already calls applyBohrenHuffmanMieTheory() to obtain the coefficients.
        Parameters:
        a - Particle size in physical units.
        lambda - Wavelength in the same units.
        cxref - Complex refractive index of the grain for the input wavelength.
        nang - Number of angles to compute. Greater than 1, and as large as possible, but must be lower than a limits of 1000.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.

      • applyBohrenHuffmanMieTheory

        public void applyBohrenHuffmanMieTheory()
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Bohren-Huffman implementation of Mie theory, to calculate scattering and absorption by a homogenous isotropic sphere.

        Original program taken from Bohren and Huffman (1983), Appendix A. Modified by B. T. Draine, Princeton Univ. Obs., 90/10/26 in order to compute the mean value of cos(theta).

        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMieCoefficients

        public static double[] getMieCoefficients(DustOpacity dust,
                          double wavelength,
                          double[] refractiveIndex,
                          int np)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the cross sections for absorption, scattering, and extinction of dust for a given size distribution. An integration is performed from 5E-3 microns up to the given maximum dust radius. This method ussually requires a a lot of computing time.
        Parameters:
        dust - Dust properties.
        wavelength - Wavelenth in microns, between 0.001 and 1000.
        refractiveIndex - The adequate refractive index for the current grain.
        np - Number of points to use when integrating in size. Recommended values are from 500 to 5000 to get an accurate result.
        Returns:
        Opacity, extinction, scattering, backscattering, mean average of cos(theta). Units are cm2/g.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
